means: 血汗工厂（指工人劳动条件差，工作时间长，工资低的工场或工厂）

sentence.Network_en: He spent three years in a sweatshop before he found a decent job.
sentence.Network_cn: 他在一家血汗工厂做了三年才找到一份像样的工作.

sentence.Network_en: But Nike suffered little financial harm over the sweatshop campaign.
sentence.Network_cn: 但在有关血汗工厂的维权活动上,耐克几乎没有遭受任何经济损失.

sentence.Network_en: I can tell you a few things that we know a sweatshop.
sentence.Network_cn: 我可告诉你我们所知道的一些情况.

entry.tran: 血汗工厂(工作条件恶劣、工资低的小工厂)
entry.def: If you describe a small factory as a sweatshop, you mean that many people work there in poor conditions for low pay.

example.ex: ...the dingy, hidden world of garment sweatshops.
example.tran: 肮脏隐蔽的血汗服装工厂

means.word_mean: 1. factory where workers do piecework for poor pay and are prevented from forming unions; common in the clothing industry
